subtitle: These pancakes are folded into cornet shapes. Freeze any pancakes you don't need.

method.text: To make pancakes: Beat milk and eggs together. Sift flour and salt into a large bowl and make a well in the centre. Gradually beat in milk mixture to make a smooth batter. Stir in chopped oregano.

Heat a little oil in a frying pan. Pour in enough batter to thinly cover base of the pan. Cook for 2-3 min until batter is set. Then turn over or flip and cook second side until golden. Stack cooked pancakes on a plate and interleave with greaseproof paper then cover with foil.

To make filling: If using fresh spinach wash in cold water and discard any tough stalks. Put into saucepan and cover. Cook without adding any water for about 5 min or until spinach has wilted. Drain well then chop. If using frozen spinach, cook and drain following pack instructions. Mix chopped spinach with curd cheese and season to taste with seasoning and nutmeg. Stir in fresh soured cream and Lancashire cheese.

Make pancakes into cornets by folding each in half and then in half again. Fill with the spinach and cheese mixture. Place in a greased ovenproof dish. Mix together the sauce ingredients, except the cheese, and pour over pancakes.
Sprinkle with cheese. Bake for 30 min. Serve hot.

title: Spinach and cheese cornets
